channel.title: Untradeble!
channel.description:
Hey, how can I make an item untradeble? Thank You and have a nice day!
- Eric E.

item.title: Untradeble!

item.description:
@Eric_E wrote:

Not really. It’s confusing. I can’t even find more then half the code’s in your post in my item.java, :S.

  • Eric E.

item.description:
@Eric_E wrote:

Where should I add: } else if (interfaceID == 3322) { // remove from bag to trade window
if (removeID == Item ID here || isUntradable(removeID)) {
sendMessage(“You cannot trade this item.”);
if (foundz[3] == 0) {}

at?

item.title: Untradeble!
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:3, topic:233529”]Ok let’s head into Item.java.

This is how you make item’s un-tradeable. Search for,

new File("data/tradeable.dat"));

You should see,

[code] try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/tradeable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemTradeable[counter] = false;
            } else {
                itemTradeable[counter] = true;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemTradeable[6570] = false;

[/code]

Those are the codes for sellable items and tradable items. Ok now in that code find the,
dataIn.close();
And under it add this,

                       itemTradeable[####] = false;

Replace the 4 number digit’s with the Item ID.

Ok now scroll down and you should see,

[code] counter = 0;
try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/sellable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemSellable[counter] = true;
            } else {
                itemSellable[counter] = false;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemSellable[####] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {[/code]

Under,

dataIn.close();

Add in,

             itemSellable[####] = false;

Remember the 4 digit symbol’s.

This tells the server that this item can not be sold to a general store and can not be traded.
Your code should look like this now.

[code] FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/tradeable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemTradeable[counter] = false;
            } else {
                itemTradeable[counter] = true;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemTradeable[####] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading tradeable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

    counter = 0;		
    try {
        FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
                new File("data/sellable.dat"));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemSellable[counter] = true;
            } else {
                itemSellable[counter] = false;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemSellable[####] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading sellable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}[/code]

You can close item.java now. Save and Compile.[/quote]

Read full topic

774

Can you put those in a code for me and tell me where to put it, if possible?

item.title: Untradeble!
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

Ok let’s head into Item.java.

This is how you make item’s un-tradeable. Search for,

new File("data/tradeable.dat"));

You should see,

[code] try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/tradeable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemTradeable[counter] = false;
            } else {
                itemTradeable[counter] = true;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemTradeable[6570] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading tradeable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

    counter = 0;		
    try {
        FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
                new File("data/sellable.dat"));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemSellable[counter] = true;
            } else {
                itemSellable[counter] = false;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemSellable[6570] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading sellable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}[/code]

Those are the codes for sellable items and tradable items. Ok now in that code find the,
dataIn.close();
And under it add this,

                       itemSellable[####] = false;

Replace the 4 number digit’s with the Item ID.

This should be in the,

[code] counter = 0;
try {
FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/sellable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemSellable[counter] = true;
            } else {
                itemSellable[counter] = false;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemSellable[6570] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading sellable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}[/code]

Code.

Do the same except for tradeable,

                       itemTradeable[####] = false;

Remember the 4 digit symbol’s.

This tells the server that this item can not be sold to a general store and can not be traded.
Your code should look like this now.

[code] FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
new File(“data/tradeable.dat”));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemTradeable[counter] = false;
            } else {
                itemTradeable[counter] = true;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemTradeable[####] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading tradeable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

    counter = 0;		
    try {
        FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(
                new File("data/sellable.dat"));

        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0) {
                itemSellable[counter] = true;
            } else {
                itemSellable[counter] = false;
            }
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
                    itemSellable[####] = false;
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading sellable! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}[/code]

You can close item.java now. Save and Compile.

Read full topic
